Attachment module¶

class tincan.attachment.Attachment(usage_type=None, display=None, description=None, content_type=None, length=None, sha2=None, file_url=None)¶

Bases: tincan.tincanbase.TinCanBaseObject

__init__(usage_type=None, display=None, description=None, content_type=None, length=None, sha2=None, file_url=None)¶
Parameters:
  • usage_type (str) – A URI describing the purpose of the attachment
  • display (tincan.languagemap) – The human readable name for the attachment
  • description (tincan.languagemap) – A plain description of the purpose of the attachment (optional)
  • content_type (str) – The MIME type of the attachment file
  • length (int) – The size of the attachment in octets
  • sha2 (str) – The sha2 hash of the contents of the attachment
  • file_url (str) – The URL of the file’s contents themselves (optional)

Language Map module¶

class tincan.languagemap.LanguageMap(map=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tincan.tincanbase.TinCanBaseObject

__init__(map=None, **kwargs)¶

Initializes a LanguageMap with the given mapping

This constructor takes in two arguments, but will only acknowledge one. The kwargs parameter is to support the from_json method, and the unpacking (**) operator. If the ‘map’ argument is specified, kwargs will be ignored.

Parameters:map (dict, LanguageMap) – The intended language mapping
Raises:LanguageMapTypeError
get_mapping()¶

Retrieve the mapping

Note

calling this method is identical to calling vars(languagemap_inst)

set_mapping(map)¶

Provides error checking when setting the mapping

Parameters:map (dict, LanguageMap) – The map that contains the desired keys and values
Raises:LanguageMapTypeError
exception tincan.languagemap.LanguageMapTypeError¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Parameters:more_url (str) – URL from a StatementsResult object used to retrieve more statements

Return type:tincan.lrs_response
query_statements(query)¶

Query the LRS for statements with specified parameters

Parameters:query (dict) – Dictionary of query parameters and their values
Returns:LRS Response object with the returned StatementsResult object as content
Return type:tincan.lrs_response
retrieve_state_ids(activity, agent, registration=None, since=None)¶

Retrieve state id’s from the LRS with the provided parameters

Parameters:
  • activity (tincan.activity) – Activity object of desired states
  • agent (tincan.agent) – Agent object of desired states
  • registration (str) – Registration UUID of desired states
  • since (str) – Retrieve state id’s since this time
Returns:

LRS Response object with the retrieved state id’s as content
Return type:

tincan.lrs_response
retrieve_statement(statement_id)¶

Retrieve a statement from the server from its id

Parameters:statement_id (str) – The UUID of the desired statement
Returns:LRS Response object with the retrieved statement as content
Return type:tincan.lrs_response
retrieve_voided_statement(statement_id)¶

Retrieve a voided statement from the server from its id

Parameters:statement_id (str) – The UUID of the desired voided statement
Returns:LRS Response object with the retrieved voided statement as content
Return type:tincan.lrs_response
save_statement(statement)¶

Save statement to LRS and update statement id if necessary

Parameters:statement (Statement) – Statement object to be saved
Returns:LRS Response object with the saved statement as content
Return type:tincan.lrs_response
save_statements(statements)¶

Save statements to LRS and update their statement id’s

Parameters:statements (list) – A list of statement objects to be saved
Returns:LRS Response object with the saved list of statements as content
Return type:tincan.lrs_response

Parameters:request (:mod:tincan.http_request`) – HTTPRequest object

TinCan Base module¶

class tincan.tincanbase.IgnoreNoneEncoder(skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, encoding='utf-8', default=None)¶

Bases: json.encoder.JSONEncoder

default(obj)¶

A Default Encoder for serializing only attributes of a class that are not None.

Note

This Encoder allows an empty object to be serialized

Params obj:the object to be serialized
class tincan.tincanbase.TinCanBaseObject¶

Bases: object

as_version(version='1.0.1')¶

Returns an object that has been modified based on versioning in order to be represented in JSON properly

A class can provide an _asVersion(self, result, version) implementation in order to tailor a more specific representation

Parameters:version (str) – the relevant version. This allows for variance between versions
classmethod from_json(json_data)¶

Tries to convert a JSON representation to an object of the same type as self

A class can provide a _fromJSON implementation in order to do specific type checking or other custom implementation details. This method will throw a ValueError for invalid JSON, a TypeError for improperly constructed, but valid JSON, and any custom errors that can be be propagated from class constructors.

Parameters:json_data (str) – The JSON string to convert
Raises:TypeError, ValueError, LangaugeMapInitError
to_json(version='1.0.1', encoder=<class 'tincan.tincanbase.IgnoreNoneEncoder'>)¶

Tries to convert an object into a JSON respresentation and return the resulting string

An Object can define how it is serialized by providing an _as_version() implementation. A caller may further define how the object is serialized by passing in a custom encoder. The default encoder will ignore properties of an object that are None at the time of serialization.

Parameters:
  • version (str) – The version to which the object must be serialized to. This will default to the latest version supported by the library.
  • encoder (json.JSONEncoder) – The custom encoder. The default is described above.
